fig.label: Figure 1

p.strong: Figure 1. MGC show increased tyrosine nitration in response to mycobacteria and TLR2/MyD88 dependency.

sd-panel.p: A Histological sections from biopsies of an osteolytic lesion of the calcaneus from a patient with M.xenopi infection, at onset of disease (1st) and 2 months later (2nd) were quantified by microscopy with hematoxylin/eosin staining and by liquid cultures (table). Image of immunohistochemistry for nitrotyrosine (red) and hematoxylin counterstaining of 2nd biopsy samples, dashed line indicating MGC; scale bar, 20µm.

fig.sd-panel: B BMMΦ were infected with increasing doses of M.bovis BCG for 6 days and MGC formation was determined by hemacolor staining.
C, D BMMΦ were infected with M.avium or M.tuberculosis for 6 days and MGC were quantified as in (B). Depicted are mean ± SEM (n=4).
C, D BMMΦ were infected with M.avium or M.tuberculosis for 6 days and MGC were quantified as in (B). Depicted are mean ± SEM (n=4).

E BMMΦ were infected with BCG-RFP (MOI15) for 6 days, fixed and stained for nitrotyrosine (green) and DAPI (blue). Representative image of reconstruction from indicated area and quantification of intracellular nitric oxide to BCG-RFP colocalization; scale bar, 20µm. Box plot of >30cells with mean ± SEM of 2 independent experiments.
F BMMΦ of wt, TLR2-/- or Unc93b-/- mice were infected with M.bovis BCG (MOI15) for 6 days and MGC were quantified as in (B).

G BMMΦ were stimulated with M.bovis BCG (MOI15) or with LP, 1µg/ml of mono-, di- or tri-acylated lipomannan from M.bovis BCG for 6 days and quantified for MGC formation as in (B). Depicted are means ± SEM from 3 independent experiments.

H BMMΦ of wt or MyD88-/- mice were transduced with retrovirus expressing MAL (pMIGR1 vector) and stimulated with LP for 6 days. MGC formation was quantified as in (B). Depicted are means ± SEM from 3 independent experiments.

sd-panel.p: I BMMΦ of wt and MyD88-/- were transduced with retrovirus expressing pMIGR1/Mal and stimulated with LP for 6 days, cells were then fixed and stained for immunofluorescence with nitrotyrosine (red) and DAPI (blue); scale bar, 100 µm.

fig.label: Figure 2

p.strong: Figure 2. MGC present dysregulation in inos expression

sd-panel.p: A BMMΦ were stimulated with live BCG (MOI 15), with heat fixed (HI) BCG, or with LP, 1µg/ml of mono-, di- or tri-acylated lipomannan from M.bovis BCG for 6 days. Then, cells were stained for intracellular iNOS and quantification by flow cytometry. Depicted are means ± SEM from 3 independent experiments.

fig.sd-panel: B, C BMMΦ were stimulated with LP and transcript levels of tnfα and inos relative to gapdh were quantified by qRT-PCR at indicated timepoints as fold change to unstimulated. Depicted are means ± SEM from 4 independent experiments.

B, C BMMΦ were stimulated with LP and transcript levels of tnfα and inos relative to gapdh were quantified by qRT-PCR at indicated timepoints as fold change to unstimulated. Depicted are means ± SEM from 4 independent experiments.

D BMMΦ were stimulated with LP and with repeated LP stimulation on day 3 where indicated and transcript levels of inos relative to gapdh were quantified by qRT-PCR at indicated timepoints as fold change to unstimulated. Depicted are means ± SEM from 3 independent experiments.

sd-panel.p: E, F BMMΦ were stimulated with LP and DNA-methylation of CpG sites -192 and -196 (D) or in the promoter/enhancer region and control site -845 (E) were analyzed by pyrosequencing at indicated timepoints. Depicted are means ± SEM of 4 independent experiments.

fig.label: Figure 3

p.strong: Figure 3. DNA damage with nuclear accumulation of p53 in MGC

sd-panel.p: A, B BMMΦ were infected with BCG (MOI15) or supplemented with NO-donor sodium nitroprusside (SNP) (300µM) for 6 days and cells were lysed with RIPA-buffer for western blot analysis of γH2Ax and p53. Densitometry of western blots relative to untreated MΦ (-). Depicted are individual experiments with mean ± SEM.

p.strong: Figure 3. DNA damage with nuclear accumulation of p53 in MGC

sd-panel.p: A, B BMMΦ were infected with BCG (MOI15) or supplemented with NO-donor sodium nitroprusside (SNP) (300µM) for 6 days and cells were lysed with RIPA-buffer for western blot analysis of γH2Ax and p53. Densitometry of western blots relative to untreated MΦ (-). Depicted are individual experiments with mean ± SEM.

fig.sd-panel: C BMMΦ were stimulated with LP for 6 days, fixed and stained for immunofluorescence by p53 (red) and DAPI (blue) for microscopy with Olympus ScanR; scale bar, 50µm.

D, E BMMΦ were stimulated with LP for indicated times, stained and imaged as described in (C) and quantified by Olympus ScanR analysis software for colocalization of p53 and DAPI staining at indicated timepoints (D) Depicted are means ± SEM of 3 independent experiments >1000cells per condition.

D, E BMMΦ were stimulated with LP for indicated times, stained and imaged as described in (C) and quantified by Olympus ScanR analysis software for colocalization of p53 and DAPI staining day 8 of LP stimulation compared to unstimulated cells (E). Depicted are means ± SEM of 3 independent experiments >1000cells per condition.

F Samples of a patient with M. xenopi osteomyelitis from repeated biopsies at onset of disease (1st) and 2 months after (2nd) were quantified by immunohistochemistry for p53 and hematoxylin counterstaining.
G Representative images of human NTM granuloma from lymphnodes, immunohistochemistry for p53 (brown) and hematoxylin counterstaining.
H Human NTM granuloma from lymphnodes of 51 patients were stained as in (G) and quantified by microscopy. Depicted are means ± SEM.
I Representative images of human NTM granuloma from lymphnodes, immunohistochemistry for p53 (brown), nitrotyrosine (red) and hematoxylin counterstaining.

sd-panel.p: J Human NTM granuloma from lymphnodes of 7 patients were stained as in (I) and quantified by microscopy and QuPath analysis software [54]. Depicted are means ± SEM.

fig.label: Figure 4

p.strong: Figure 4. Restored p53 activity by nutlin3a impairs MGC formation and inos dysregulation

sd-panel.p: A Representative images of unstimulated BMMΦ from wt and p53-/- mice at day 6 with hemacolor staining (left), LP stimulation for 6 days and quantification for MGC formation by hemacolor staining (right). Depicted are means ± SEM of 3 independent experiments; scale bar, 50µm.

fig.sd-panel: B BMMΦ were stimulated with LP for indicated times and either lysed with RIPA-buffer for western blot analysis of p53 levels or used to quantify transcript levels p21 relative to gapdh by qRT-PCR as fold change to unstimulated. Depicted are mean ± SEM from 3 independent experiments.

C BMMΦ stimulated with LP from (B) were used for p53 ChIP at indicated timepoints and quantified by qRT-PCR for amplification of p53-associated p21 promoter region as fold change to unstimulated. Depicted are means ± SEM from 3 independent experiments.

D Representative images of BMMΦ stimulated with LP, fixed and stained with γ-tubulin (grey) for centrosomes, α/β-tubulin (green) for cytoplasm and DAPI (blue), and quantification of centrosome number per cell. Depicted are means ± SEM from 3 independent experiments with each >100cells; scale bar, 20µm.

E BMMΦ were stimulated with LP for 6 days and supplemented with 10µM nutlin3a for indicated times and MGC formation was quantified by hemacolor staining. Depicted are means ± SEM from 3 independent experiments.

F BMMΦ were stimulated with LP and 10µM nutlin3a and quantified for inos transcript levels by qRT-PCR at indicated times as fold change to unstimulated. Depicted are means ± SEM from 4 independent experiments. *p < 0.05, **p < 0.01 (two-tailed unpaired t-test).

fig.label: Figure 5

p.strong: Figure 5. Definition of MGC specific genes and increased phagocytosis but reduced killing in MGC

sd-panel.p: A Volcano plot of microarray data of BMMΦ stimulated with LP for 6 days, as log2 fold-change to unstimulated. Black dots indicate <2 fold differentially expressed genes with significantly upregulated genes in red and downregulated genes in blue. Piecharts show the MGC specific set of genes defined by significantly differential expression in LP and nutlin3a (10µM) stimulated BMMΦ compared to LP stimulation alone.

fig.sd-panel: B Heatmap of gene expression pattern in BMMΦ after 6 days of stimulation with LP or LP and nutlin3a (n3a) (10µM). Depicted are standardized log2 differences (subtract mean divided by standard deviation) of all significantly upregulated genes in MGC in comparison to untreated and n3a-treated MΦ. Gene array was performed with 2 independent biological replicates per group.

C Representative images of BMMΦ and LP stimulation derived MGC of day 6 with internalized 1µm and 10µm beads and staining for immunofluorescence by phalloidin (turquoise) and quantification of bead uptake after 24 hours by FACS. Depicted are 3 independent experiments with mean; scale bar, 20 µm.
D Representative image of 11day old BMMΦ infected with BCG-RFP (MOI15) for 48 hours and addition of dead-cell marker DAPI (blue), indicating apoptotic cells; scale bar, 20 µm.
E Representative image of 11day old BMMΦ infected with undefined-RFP (MOI15) for 7 days, fixed and stained with phalloidin (green) and DAPI (blue) for immunofluorescence; scale bar, 50µm.
F BMMΦ were infected with MGC-RFP for 6 days (yellow dashed-line) and applied on MGC from BMMΦ stimulation with LP for 6 days (white dashed-line) for live-cell imaging of 24 hours; scale bar, 20µm.
G BMMΦ and MGC from BMMΦ stimulation with LP for 6 days were quantified for uptake of apoptotic BMMΦ at indicated times after addition, by FACS. Depicted are mean ± SEM of 3 independent experiments.

sd-panel.p: H BMMΦ and MGC, from BMMΦ stimulation with LP for 6 days, were infected with BCG of indicated MOI. Cells were lysed after 72 hours and plated on 7H11 agar for CFU quantification after 3 weeks.

fig.label: Figure 6

p.strong: Figure 6. MGC formation is dependent on iNOS induced DNA damage

sd-panel.p: A BMMΦ from wt and iNOS-/- mice were stimulated with LP for 6 days and quantified for MGC formation by hemacolor staining. Depicted are means ± SEM of 3 independent experiments.

fig.sd-panel: B BMMΦ were stimulated with LP and aminoguanidine (0.1 - 1mM) for 6 days and quantified for MGC formation as in (A). Depicted are means ± SEM of 4 independent experiments.
C BMMΦ from wt and iNOS-/- mice were stimulated with LP or supplemented with SNP (300µM) for 6 days and quantified for MGC formation as in (A). Depicted are means ± SEM of 3 independent experiments.
D, E BMMΦ from wt and iNOS-/- mice were stimulated with LP and aminoguanidine (1mM) for 6 days and lysed with RIPA-buffer for western blot analysis of γH2Ax (D)
D, E BMMΦ from wt and iNOS-/- mice were stimulated with LP and aminoguanidine (1mM) for 6 days and lysed with RIPA-buffer for western blot analysis of p53 levels (E).

F Representative images of mouse ears8 weeks p.i. with PBS+ 5% mineral oil only (vehicle) or with addition of 105 CFUs BCG-RFP. Infected area was stained for immunofluorescence with nitrotyrosine (green) and DAPI (blue) and counterstained with hematoxylin/eosin; scale bar, 100µm.
G Whole ear lysates from 3 and 8 weeks of BCG-RFP infected wt and iNOS-/- mice were plated on 7H11 agar and quantified for CFUs after 3 weeks. Depicted are measn ± SEM of 4 mice.
H Surgically dissected ears from wt and iNOS-/- mice were frozen as cryo-blocks, cut and stained by hematoxylin/eosin for analysis by microscopy. Depicted are means ± SEM of 3-7 mice.
I BMMΦ from wt and p47-/- mice were stimulated with LP for 6 days and quantified for MGC formation as in (A). Depicted are means ± SEM of 3 independent experiments.

sd-panel.p: J BMMΦ were stimulated with LP and diphenyleneiodonium (DPI) (0.25 - 0.5µM) for 6 days and quantified for MGC formation as in (A). Depicted are means ± SEM of 3 independent experiments.
